contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = One And A Half | Type = EP | Artist = [[Train (band)|Train]] | Cover = Train One and a Half.jpg | Alt = | Released = October 21, 1999 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]], [[roots rock]] | Length = | Label = [[Aware Records|Aware]] | Producer = | Last album = ''[[Live from Fantasy Studios]]''<br>(1998) | This album = '''''One And A Half'''''<br>(1999) | Next album = ''[[Drops of Jupiter]]''<br>(2001) }} '''''One and a Half''''' is a [[Train (band)|Train]] EP ([[extended play]]) that was released in very limited numbers in 1999. It was recorded and released between the ''[[Train (album)|Train]]'' and ''[[Drops of Jupiter]]'' albums. The [[Extended play|EP]] included some new never-before-released tracks such as "Counting on You", "Sweet Rain", "The Highway", an acoustic version of Train's hit single "Meet Virginia" from their 1998 self-titled debut, and an acoustic cover of [[Led Zeppelin]]'s "Ramble On". ==Track listing== All tracks written by Patrick Monahan, Rob Hotchkiss, Jimmy Stafford, Scott Underwood and Charlie Colin unless otherwise noted. # Counting on You <small>(Monahan / Hotchkiss)</small> - 3:56 # Hopeless - 4:32 # [[Ramble On]] <small>[acoustic] ([[Jimmy Page]] / [[Robert Plant]])</small> - 5:01 # Sweet Rain - 5:18 # The Highway - 4:28 # [[Meet Virginia]] <small>[acoustic] (Monahan / Hotchkiss / Stafford)</small> - 4:02 Photography by Jeff Verne/Philadelphia {{Train}} {{DEFAULTSORT:One And A Half}} [[Category:Train (band) albums]] [[Category:Live EPs]] [[Category:1999 EPs]] [[Category:1999 live albums]] {{1990s-rock-album-stub}}
